definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: We are peacefully demonstrating while they are throwing tear gas and bullets," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我們在進行和平示威，而他們發射催淚瓦斯和槍彈。

sentences.english: The bullet traversed my hand, but it came out through my back.
sentences.chinese: 槍彈打通了手，又從我背上穿出去。

sentences.english: With my own ears I clearly heard the heart beat of the nucclear bomb.
sentences.chinese: 我親耳清晰地聽到原槍彈的心臟的跳動。

sentences.english: On the following week thirty thousand cartridges were distributed.
sentences.chinese: 一星期過後，又散發了槍彈三萬發。

sentences.english: With my own ears Iclearly heard the heart beat of the nuclear bomb.
sentences.chinese: 我親耳清晰地聽到原槍彈的心臟的跳動。

sentences.english: She was shot through the body and knew she going to cash in.
sentences.chinese: 她的身體被槍彈射穿，知道自己就要死了。

sentences.english: While the battle raged , the bullets flew thick as hail .
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥激烈進行時，槍彈密如雨點。

sentences.english: The early time uses in the flintlock bullet which the firearms launch many for the iron grain or the lead shot.
sentences.chinese: 早期用於槍械發射的火槍槍彈多爲鐵粒或鉛丸。

sentences.english: To make matters worse is that there are still several rounds of gun firing bullets yet.
sentences.chinese: 更糟糕的是，槍中還有幾發尚未擊發的槍彈。

definition: the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
to recover (illegally obtained property)/to seize/to capture/to force sb to hand over sth/to levy
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
to attack with a bladed weapon
to escort (goods or funds)/to convey under guard
window with an iron grating (apartment etc)/barred window of a prison cell
